turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Good swell.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: What, sir?

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: I said it's a good swell -- hell of a good swell 'bout six feet. Let's get a look at it.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: You think that section on the point is ridable, Lance?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: I think we ought to wait for the tide to come in.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: They far enough?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Sure -- fine --

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: You smell that.  You smell that?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Napalm, boy -- nothing else in the world smells like that --

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: The wind --

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Yeah, I'm an artist, goddamit !

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Yeah -- yeah, I can understand how you feel.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Mike, you know anything about the point at Vin Drip Drop?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Boss left.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's really long left slide, breaks on the short side of the point -- catches a south swell.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Why the hell didn't you tell me about that place -- a good left.  There aren't any good left slides in this whole, shitty country. It's all goddamn beach break.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's hairy ,though. That's where we lost McDonnel -- they shot the hell out of us. It's Charlie's point.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: How big it is?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Six to eight feet.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Change.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Wh -- what?

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Change -- get out there -- I want'a see if it's ridable -- change.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It's still pretty hairy, sir.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: You want'a surf, soldier?

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Big Duke Six to Hell's Angels Four -- bring it in on along tree line and huts.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Hell's Angels Four to Big Duke Six -- we'll need green smoke -- suggest you have the FAC mark it.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Haven't got time, Hell's Angels -- lay it right up the tree line.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: This is Baker Delta Four -- Captain hit bad -- need dust-off. Receiving heavy automatic weapons fire from huts about thirty yards to our left.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Big Duke Six to Baker Delta Four -- hold -- we're right over you.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Eagle Thrust Four -- Big Duke Six. Join me in sparaying some trees.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Affirmative, Big Duke Six -- We're even got some rockets left.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Take her in low, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Captain B-L. Willard, sir -- 4th Recon Group -- I carry priority papers from Com-Sec Intelligence 11 Corp -- I believe you understand the nature of my mission.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Yeah -- Na Trang told me to expect you -- we'll see what we can do. Just stay out of my way till this is done, Captain.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: My orders are from Com-Sec Intel -- B.L. Willard, 4th Recon --

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Just hold up a second, Captain -- I'll get to you soon enough -- We've got things to do here.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Why the hell you wanna go up to Nu Mung Ba for?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I got bored in Saigon.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: What's the furthest you been in?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Haiphong.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Haiphong? Shit, you jump in ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No. Walked.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: What'd you do for supplies?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Mercenaries -- agents, traitors -- they put out caches.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Can you trust them?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No. They put out two or three for every one I needed. When you get to the one you'll use, you just stake it out. If something feels wrong, you just pass it up. On one mission, I had to pass up three and ended up living on rats and chocolate bars.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Nu Mung Ba. Last I heard, Walter Kurtz commanded a Green Beret detachment at Nu Mung Ba.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: When did you hear?

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: 'Bout a year ago? Is Kurtz still alive?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Who knows.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Seems to me he got himself fragged. i heard some grunt rolled a grenade in his tent. Maybe a rumor. Helluva man -- remarkable officer. Walter Kurtz woulda been a General some day. General of the Army. Shit, Head of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. Did you knew Kurtz?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I met him.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Don't you agree?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: He musta changed !  I got to get into the Nung River, here or here.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: That village you're pointing at is kinda hairy.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Hairy ?

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: I mean it's hairy -- they got some pretty heavy ordnance, boy -- I've lost a few recon ships in there now and again.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: So? I heard you had a good bunch of killers here.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: And I don't intend to get some of them chewed up just to get your tub put in the mouth of the goddman Nung River. You say you don't know Kurtz?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I met him.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: You talk like him. I don't mind taking casualties, Captain, but I like to keep my ratio ten to one in this unit -- ten Cong to one.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You'll find enough Cong up there.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: What about this point here?

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: We'll come in low out of the rising sun -- We'll put on the music about a mile out.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Music?

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Yeah. Classical stuff -- scares the hell out of the slopes -- the boys love it.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Fucking savages.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: The enemy. Who else?

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Sonuvabitch -- anybody hurt?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Automatic weapons flashes along those trees -- probably eleven millimeter guns and AK-47's.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: The trees, eh...

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I'm waiting for the fucking boat, Colonel.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: It'll get here, soldier.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You know, some day this war's gonna end..

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: Yes, I know.

turns.speaker: KILGORE
turns.text: It's gonna blow this place out. It's gonna ruin it ...

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: The kid can't ride sloppy waves.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Colonel Kurtz, I guess.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: I'm Kurtz.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Captain B.L. Willard reporting his presence, sir.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Why did you come to ... my province.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We were attacked -- down river. We need supplies and medical help.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: You were not coming here, to see me?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No -- no, sir.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: You came up my river -- in that small boat. So simple. I always thought the final justice would come from the sky, like we did.  You are the final justice, aren't you?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What do you mean, Colonel?

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: What other reason could you have come? A Captain. Ranger. Paratrooper. Graduate of the Recondo School. Am I right about these things?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You know you're right.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Do you know me?

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Yeah, I can see that. He's fuckin nuts --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: I said get the fuck out !  I'm going to kill the little weirdo myself tomorrow.  He's only stayed alive this long because he's a good orderly and medic. He knows how to use a hypodermic.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You're gonna get hit tonight, bad -- a whole regiment of NVA regulars.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: That's right, the little gook- pricks. But they are noble little gook-pricks, noble. Because they fight with their guts, like animals. And for an idea ! That's rich. We fight with ingenious machines and fire, like Gods, and for nothing. But I'll call in a major blotto airstrike tonight. We'll have ourselves a helluva airstrike tonight, a lightshow. How do you like The Doors': 'C'mon Baby Light My Fire...'

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yeah, I like it...

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: I love it.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You've gone crazy.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: No. My thinking is clear.  But my soul has gone mad.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: No -- I don't want to sleep. I want to think. Water. Give me water.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You can't have water after morphine.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Still playing by the rules.  You're a damn good kiler.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: How's the pain?

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: How's yours?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I can handle it.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Pain is easy to handle -- but nobility.. the nobility of a man is judged by how much Truth he can handle.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What Truth?

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: The truth that you were sent here to murder me, ans so far you haven't done it. And do you know why?  Yes, you know why.  Your mission makes about as much sense as those idiots who sent you on it. Asshole ! Schmuck ! How long does it take you to figure out that nobody knows what they're doing here.  Except me.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Gimme water.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No water.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: You know what you're doing? You are interfering with my plans !

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: How did we get here?

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Because of all the things we do, the thing we do best -- is lie.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I think think a lie stinks.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Oh Captain, that is so true.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Stinks. I could never figure --  I could never figure how they can teach boys how to bomb villages with napalm -- and not let them write the word 'fuck' on their airplanes.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: You could never figure it because it doesn't make sense.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Fuck no.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: I'll tell you what makes sense ! Air strikes ! White Phosphorus ! Napalm ! We'll bomb the shit out of them if they don't do what we want.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We'll exterminate the fuckers !

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Go away -- hide yourself.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Going back  - to the jungle to die.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I'm taking you back. You can still live.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: I had immense plans.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I'm gonna get you out of here.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: I was on threshold of great things.

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: My river... my people... my jungle... my ideas... my country... my wife...  ... my death.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You had immense plans... immense plans...

turns.speaker: KURTZ
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I'm taking you back.

turns.speaker: KURTZ'S WIFE
turns.text: Did you know him very well?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You get to know each other pretty well out there.

turns.speaker: KURTZ'S WIFE
turns.text: And you admired him?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: He was a remarkable man. It was impossible not to --

turns.speaker: KURTZ'S WIFE
turns.text: Love him... Yes, it is true. That's the hard part for me... I knew him better than anyone ... I knew him best.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You knew him best.

turns.speaker: KURTZ'S WIFE
turns.text: You were his friend... You must have been, if he had given you this...  If he sent you to his home. He was the best this country had -- he was --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yes, I know...

turns.speaker: KURTZ'S WIFE
turns.text: I'll never get over it -- But I'll always remember him...

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Both of us...

turns.speaker: KURTZ'S WIFE
turns.text: Men looked up to him...  He died as he lived...

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: His death was -- yes, he died as he lived.

turns.speaker: KURTZ'S WIFE
turns.text: Were you with him, when...

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yes I was... He said his last words to me.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Maybe he'll get tubed.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Maybe he'll get inside the tube -- where -- where they can't see him.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Just something I read in the Free Press.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: He'll kill us.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: He can't kill us.  We're on his side.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Are you finished surfing?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Yeah... thanks.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Want to say goodbye to the Colonel?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Nah.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Then let's get the hell out of here.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: No -- no, Captain.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Which one's the Colonel's?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: The Yater -- the clear one with the thin stringer.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: This one , Lance?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Yeah, Jesus Christ !

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Maybe we better stay in under the trees till dark -- we got his Yater.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: He didn't look like he'd take that sitting down.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: You hear it again?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No -- I don't think so. But it'll be back. They were circling. It'll be back.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: You think he'd of shot us?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Any time -- us -- Americans.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I don't think he'd of shot us on the beach but -- he'd of shot us if he saw me taking the board --

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: A Yater spoon is hard to get -- especially here.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: He's a man who knows what he wants -- he does know what he wants.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: Captain -- that was all true about the rats and chocolate and stuff?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: And you could just tell when the supplies were booby trapped?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: It's a feeling you get in the jungle. When you get good, you can find a track and tell not only how many they are, but their morale, how far they're going, whether they're near their camp, the weapons they're carrying.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: What's this tiger shit?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No shit... I think I shot the hell out of him.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: You think?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I wasn't looking.. I was running.

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: The other one --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No -- leave it --

turns.speaker: LANCE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Bring your rifles, that's all.  Take us to him.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Captain Willard?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: That's me.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Captain Willard -- we got these from Nha Thrang two days ago -- they expected you here then --

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: You don't know how happy that makes me, sir.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Now I can get out a here -- if I can find a way out.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We'll be needing some supplies and fuel -- do you know anybody who can give me a hand?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: I'd just clear out as soon as I could if I were you, sir. They're gonna start working on the bridge with torches again. Charlie will start throwing it in hard --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What is this bridge?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: It's of strategic importance for keeping the highway into Bat Shan open -- the generals don't like to admit that Bat Shan is surrounded.

turns.speaker: MOONBY
turns.text: This boat's a mess.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Where's Kurtz? I want to talk to him.

turns.speaker: MOONBY
turns.text: Oh, you don't talk to Colonel Kurtz.  You listen to him. God, these are good. I kept these people off you, you know. It wasn't easy.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Why did they attack us?

turns.speaker: MOONBY
turns.text: Simple. They don't want him to go.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: You're Australian?

turns.speaker: MOONBY
turns.text: Pre-Australian, actually. But I'd dig goin' to California. I'm California dreamin'.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: So Kurtz is alive.

turns.speaker: MOONBY
turns.text: Kurtz. I tell you, that man has enlarged my mind.

turns.speaker: MOONBY
turns.text: But lemme tell you, he is the most dangerous thing in every way that I've come on so far. He wanted to shoot me. The first thing he said is, 'I'm going to shoot you because you are a deserter.' I said I didn't desert from your army, I deserted from my army. He said, 'I'm going to shoot you just the same.'

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Why didn't he shoot you?

turns.speaker: MOONBY
turns.text: I've asked myself that question. I said to myself, why didn't he shoot me? He didn't shoot me, because I had a stash like you wouldn't believe. I hid it in the jungle; the wealth of the Orient: Marijuana -- Hashish -- Opium -- cocaine -- uncut Heroin; the Gold of the Golden Triangle. and Acid -- I make Koolaid that makes purple Owsley come on like piss. Now I'm Kurtz' own Disciple -- I listen he talks. About everything ! Everything. I forgot there's such a thing as sleep. Everything. Of love, too.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Sounds like he's gone crazy.

turns.speaker: MOONBY
turns.text: No, Colonel Kurtz couldn't be crazy -- if you heard him talk, just last week, you'd never think he was crazy.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Is that where he is? By the shrunken heads.

turns.speaker: MOONBY
turns.text: Those heads, yes. Well, the rebels...

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We're going ashore. Tie her up -- and leave your guns up, Lance.

turns.speaker: MOONBY
turns.text: Right on -- he's been waiting for --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: And shut up.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: MOONBY
turns.text: His name is...

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I'm not ever goin' to tell you to shut up again.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: May I ask where the Captain is going in his little boat?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: We were going upriver when we got caught in a storm, ma'am.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: You must realize, Captain -- we have lost much here -- I, my husband. Gaston -- his wife and son.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I'm sorry to hear that.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: Cognac?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I should be checking on the boat.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: The war will still be here tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: Do you miss your home, Captain? Have you someone there?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: No. Not really.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: What will you do after the war?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I just follow my footsteps, one at a time, trying to answer the little questions and staying away from the big ones.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: What's a big question?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Kurtz.  I know you've heard of him.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What did you hear?

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: That strange things.. terrible things have occured around this American, Kurtz.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What things?

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: Gaston would never tell me. It was asubject not to be spoken of, Captain.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: Did you know -- deeper in the jungle, upriver -- there are savages?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: But Captain, I mean -- cannibals.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: Are you warm, Captain?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: The river is beautiful.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I'm afraid I won't have time -- I gotta --

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: Whe you reach the boat you will find that half your fifty calibre stores -- a case of grenades, a mortar and two M-16's and a case of clips are being transfered to us by your order.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: So that's it.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: You may think what you wish, Captain, but I like you very much.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What if I say no.

turns.speaker: ROXANNE
turns.text: Then Philippe will have to kill all of you.

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: I don't know anything about these papers, sir.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: They're in order -- it's perfectly clean -- just check with ComSec- Intel like I said.

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: Well, you know I don't have the priority to do that, sir. It says here not to contact Com-Sec- Int. Who's your commanding officer ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Right now -- I am.

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: Well who the hell verifies that ?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What show ?

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: Big show in the parade grounds this noon -- some boss stuff --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: This -- Bob Hope or the like --

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: No sir, I think -- this'll be a little bit different --

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: That's 27, sir.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Anyone got a card?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Soldier -- where''s your C.O.?

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Stepped on a booby trap, sir -- got blown all to hell --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Well , who's in command here?

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: I don't know -- don't have any idea -- I'm just the night man --

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: You came right to it, son of a bitch --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Son of a bitch, sir.

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: Where's your chief supply officer?

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Beverly Hills --

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Straight up the road -- a concrete bunker -- Beverly Hills -- where else you think he'd be?

turns.speaker: WILLARD
turns.text: C'mon --
20   CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You can pack out of here -- two, three days' hike along this river at most.  Weather should hold this early in the season.
23   CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Needs patching.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Hard to work up an interest in politics, way we live.  You're the first people we've seen in two weeks.
23   CONTINUED:
30   CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Now, why don't you get around to saying what you want.
34   CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Mind if I get some stuff from my kit?

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: See the blood?  Pack of wolves took down a moose.  Greedy, gut-ripping sons of bitches.  I'd kill the last wolf on earth, right in front of the President of the U.S.  Stinking, cowardly predator, the wolf.
89   CONTINUED:
102  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Wait 'til I'm across!

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: You talk about ecology -- there it is.
107  CONTINUED:
117  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Inside of three hours you'd be dragging my dead carcass.
134  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Used to see the natives eating roots when I was a kid in Nome.

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: First you save my ass, now you want to kill me.  Make up your goddamn mind.
134  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: What makes you so sure my boys won't be waiting for us?
139  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Remember that demon in the gut? Sometimes it's nothing more than wondering if the so-called civilized life has bred the balls and brains out of you.  That's what you want out of this, isn't it?
150  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: Relax.  I got a nervous man here with a magnum up my nose.
175  CONTINUED:
215  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: CORBETT
turns.text: So they can patch me up and put me in a cage?  Forget it. Meyerling's right -- I'm a dinosaur.  Greedy bastards like him, it's their turn with this land.  Put me in the woods, let me live or die on my own.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Avalanche season is coming.
43   CONTINUED:
48   CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I'll get you there all right.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Let's go.
94   CONTINUED:
95   CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: It'll be interesting, trying to build a fire without any wood.
113  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I just want this over with.
119  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: How?  Nobody this far north monitors that frequency until avalanche season.  Besides, I'm surprised a tough guy like you uses fancy electronics.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: ...I won't let a killer walk!
157  CONTINUED:
165  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: There isn't one, unless Corbett's men get here before the plane does.
165  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: I'd sure like that favor you offered a while back.

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: You'll catch a chill by that dumb waiter shaft.  Sit on the cot.  Keep this pointed at him if I get preoccupied.
168  CONTINUED:
184  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Your infrared camera?
212  CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Keep back.
26   CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: I was making my rounds, saw your hangar wide open, plane getting rained on, so I closed it up.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: Watch it with Meyerling.  Man's as mean and corrupt as they get. Cut his mother's throat if it'd get him a couple votes.
26   CONTINUED:
27   CONTINUED:

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: Question is why they sat here when the storm moved in.  Check their stuff while I sniff around.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: A certain sonofabitch bastard -more-
28   CONTINUED:
